refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: sum The sum operator calculates the cumulative sum of a group of values. For the corresponding aggregate, see the sum aggregate reference.

refsect1.title: Inputs
refsect1.para:
The sum operator takes the following arguments:
array: A source array with one or more attributes and one or more dimensions.
attribute: Optional attribute. If no attribute is provided, the first attribute in the source array is used.
dimension_n: An optional list of dimensions to group by.

informalexample.para: This example sums the columns and rows of a 3×3 array.

step.para:
Create a 1-attribute, 2-dimensional array called m3x3:
AFL% CREATE ARRAY m3x3 <val:double>[i=0:2,3,0,j=0:2,3,0];

Sum the values of m3x3 along dimension j. This sums the columns of m3x3:
AFL% sum(m3x3,val,j); [(9),(12),(15)]

Sum the values of m3x3 along dimension i. This sums the rows of m3x3:
AFL% sum(m3x3,val,i); [(3),(12),(21)]
